title: BBC Local Live: Shropshire on Friday 12 May 2017 - BBC News
summary: shropshire hospitals unaffected by nhs cyber attack .
elderly couple rescued from canal boat .
shrewsbury town extend the contract of winger whalley .

documents.title: watch : your 50-second weather forecast
text: we can expect showers on and off throughout most of the day and the wind will up a little too , with top temperatures of 15c ( 59f ) .
you can find a detailed forecast for your area on the bbc weather site .
author: Charlie Slater
BBC Weather presenter

documents.title: our live coverage across the day
text: we 'll be back with our usual mix of news , sport , travel and weather from 08:00 on monday .

documents.title: lawley children to play at wembley
text: pupils from lawley primary school are going to play at wembley on sunday , in the finals of the english schools football association seven-a-side cup .
they 're taking part in the under-11s competition for small schools and their game will kick-off ahead of sunday 's national league playoff final between tranmere rovers and forest green rovers .
author: James Bond
Sports Producer, BBC Shropshire

documents.title: cricket : shropshire face wales at oswestry
text: shropshire will look to bounce back from their defeat to cheshire when they take on wales in the knockout trophy on sunday .
neither side has won a game in the tournament this year and shropshire make one change for the match , bringing in shifnal all-rounder jack edwards , to replace the injured dillon pennington .
the first ball will be bowled at oswestry at 11:00 .

documents.title: weather : a dry weekend , but heavy rain to come
text: we 're due a dry , but cloudy weekend , with a little bit of sun breaking through and temperatures up to 18c ( 64f ) in places .
but it 's not looking so good for monday , with heavy rain forecast for most of us .
author: Rebecca Wood
BBC Weather

documents.title: food festival returns to ludlow
text: the ludlow spring festival opens this evening and continues through the weekend .
there will be dozens of stalls inside the castle courtyard , plus music , food trails and classic cars .

documents.title: village school creates 'reflection garden '
text: telford 's smallest school has had a big makeover in its grounds .
st lawrence church of england primary at preston upon the weald moors has got new flower beds , vegetable patches , water features and textured paths , to create a place for quiet reflection .
parents , staff and pupils pitched in , and it was officially opened earlier this afternoon .

documents.title: whitchurch to get skate park after 10-year wait
text: work on a new skate park in whitchurch is expected to start in the summer , after funding was found for the project .
it will be built in jubilee park and the construction should take between six and eight weeks , shropshire council says .
the local authority says it 's taken 10 years to get the money together , with whitchurch town council , next generation youth and twemlows solar farm all chipping in .
it 's great that so many people want to get involved with skateboarding and bmxing , and i can only see this interest increasing given that they are both olympic sports . ''

documents.title: breakinghospitals 'unaffected ' by suspected cyber-attack
text: the hospitals in shrewsbury , telford and oswestry say they are unaffected by the suspected cyber-attack which is affecting parts of the nhs this afternoon .
trusts and hospitals in london , blackburn , nottingham , cumbria and hertfordshire have all had their it services affected .

documents.title: whalley signs two-year shrewsbury deal
text: whalley signs two-year shrewsbury deal

documents.title: anniversary of gay meadow closure
text: sunday will mark 10 years since the last game was played at shrewsbury town 's gay meadow stadium .
the 0-0 draw with milton keynes in the league two play-offs brought the curtain down on 97 years of history .
the demolition of the old ground started just a few months later , in september 2007 and by 2014 there were luxury flats on the site .
author: BBC Sport

documents.title: more than 30 steam engine to take part in rally
text: more than 30 steam engines will be parading through ironbridge tomorrow as part of celebrations to mark the 50th anniversary of the ironbridge gorge museums trust .
they 're due to start at blists hill at 10:00 and will be accompanied by enthusiasts wearing victorian costume .

documents.title: two elderly people rescued from canal lock near whitchurch
text: two elderly people were rescued from a narrowboat after it got stuck at the bottom of an empty canal lock near whitchurch today .
author: Shropshire Star

documents.title: football : town winger has contract renewed
text: shrewsbury town football club have extended the contract of winger shaun whalley .
he 'll be with the club for another two years .
the 30-year-old was brought into the team two years ago by the then manager micky mellon after leaving luton .
current manager paul hurst says he 's a creative player that other clubs would have been interested in .
author: BBC Sport

documents.title: your photos : rain in oakengates and ludlow
text: the sunny weather has been replaced by drizzle today , as you can see from these bbc weather watchers photos , taken near oakengates ( top ) and ludlow ( below ) .
author: BBC Weather Watchers

documents.title: walker passing through on a5 journey
text: a man from bangor who is attempting to walk the complete length of the a5 is in the county today .

david elis-williams is travelling from marble arch in london to holyhead in wales , but has decided to take a break after reaching shropshire - and will complete the rest of the journey later in the year .
mr elis-williams has taken 11 days so far and says he is attempting the walk because he is fascinated by history and the importance of the a5 and the roman roads which came before it .

i think the one thing that actually inspired me - there is a sign at atherstone in warwickshire on the side of a shop there in the high street and it points a finger to holyhead one way and a finger to london the other way and i thought , gosh ! ''

documents.title: firefighter in world record rugby bid
text: a firefighter from bridgnorth is among a team of rugby players hoping to break a world record today for the longest ever rugby union match .
luke veal and his team-mates are taking on a team of armed service personnel at sixways in worcester in an attempt to break the current world record of 29 hours and 34 minutes .

they 're aiming to raise £ 46,000 for the fire fighters charity and scotty 's little soldiers , which provides support to children who have lost a parent serving in the armed forces and the game is being refereed by a man from telford .

documents.title: elderly couple rescued from canal
text: an elderly couple have been helped from a boat near whitchurch , after it got stuck in a lock on the shropshire union canal .
fire crews from the town lowered a nine-metre ladder to the boat at grindley brook , but the pair were n't hurt .
author: Tim Page
News Editor, BBC Shropshire

documents.title: shropshire kids fest returns this weekend
text: the shropshire kids fest returns to the quarry in shrewsbury this weekend .

children will get the chance to try a range of activities including playing musical instruments , petting animals , taking part in sports , playing on bouncy castles and clambering up climbing walls .
it 's the second year the event has taken place and it 's organised by the group which puts on the telfood feastival and the shrewsbury winter festival .

documents.title: festival flash sale on tickets
text: a two-for-one deal has been launched to sell tickets to the staffordshire v festival online .
ticketmaster has launched the 72-hour flash sale - acts including p ! nk , jay z , ellie goulding and madness will feature over the two-day festival on 19 and 20 august .
the festival is held simultaneously at weston park near shifnal and hylands park in chelmsford , with live acts taking to the stage at one venue on saturday and the other venue on sunday .
v festival is the biggest annual music festival in the west midlands .
last year up to 90,000 revellers gathered to see headlines acts including justin bieber and rihanna .

documents.title: long hot summer of delays as work planned on 160 shropshire roads
text: motorists face a long , hot summer of delays and diversions after it was revealed 160 roads across shropshire are to be dug up .
author: Shropshire Star

documents.title: ice hockey : tigers future could become clearer this weekend
text: telford tigers will learn this weekend if they 've been admitted to join the english national league next season .
they 've applied to join the north division , following the collapse of the english premier league and that application will be considered at a league meeting on sunday .
it 's not clear what will happen to the tigers development side if they make the move - because it already plays in that division .
author: Andy Giddings
BBC Shropshire

documents.title: shropshire hills to become a work of art
text: an artist , using a strimmer instead of a paintbrush , is creating a work of art on the south shropshire hills .
tony plant has been commissioned to transform part of carding mill valley in church stretton .
working with a team of national trust volunteers he 'll be making large scale patterns in the bracken which will be visible from other hills .
the heartlands project will see three artists exploring new ways of seeing and understanding the shropshire hills landscape .
they will only be temporary and the bracken will eventually grow back and the patterns disappear .
author: Genevieve Tudor
Journalist, BBC Shropshire

documents.title: fans mark decade since gay meadow closure
text: this sunday will mark the 10th anniversary of the closure of shrewsbury town 's gay meadow stadium .
the spot it sat on , next to the river , is now a housing development and apart from some of the road names on the estate , there 's really no sign of the ground ever having been there .
but fan and local historian mike jones believes it still has an important place in the history of the town .

documents.title: north shropshire general election candidates named
text: nominations closed last night for candidates standing in the general election on 8 june .
here is the full list of those contesting the north shropshire seat :
author: Tim Page
News Editor, BBC Shropshire

documents.title: motorcyclist in hospital after a49 crash
text: a motorcyclist in his 30s has been seriously hurt in a crash with a car on the a49 at prees green at 18:50 yesterday .
the police say the man was taken to hospital suffering from chest , arm , leg and pelvis injuries .
the driver of the car was uninjured .

documents.title: shrewsbury & atcham general election candidates named
text: there are five people contesting the shrewsbury & atcham seat on 8 june :
author: Tim Page
News Editor, BBC Shropshire

documents.title: shropshire spoons make historic list
text: a pair of 2,000-year-old hand-sized spoons found at nesscliffe have made it on to the list of top 20 archaeological finds .
half a dozen experts in celtic , romano-british , medieval and early modern archaeology met at the british museum to select 20 finds from a long-list of objects on display .
the spoons made it on to the list called treasure20 which is a year-long celebration of the portable antiquities scheme .
made of a copper alloy it 's not clear what the spoons were used for .
it was certainly something more important than eating prehistoric porridge .
the current thinking is that they may have been used for divination .
liquid would be dripped from one to the other and predictions or judgments made .
shropshire and herefordshire finds liaison officer , peter reavill , says that they are the most important item on the list of 20 .
author: Les Walton
Journalist, BBC Shropshire

documents.title: wrekin general election candidates announced
text: candidates for the wrekin :
author: Tim Page
News Editor, BBC Shropshire

documents.title: locals trying to buy pub
text: regulars who drink at their village pub are hoping to buy it to stop it being turned into a house .
the railway at yorton , near wem , has been owned by the same family for 80 years , but is on the market after the death , earlier this year , of landlady liz newnes .

documents.title: ludlow general election candidates named
text: the deadline for general election nominations closed on thursday evening and there are four people standing in the ludlow seat on 8 june :
the deadline to register to vote in the general election is 22 may .
postal and proxy votes can be requested online until 23 may .
author: Tim Page
News Editor, BBC Shropshire

documents.title: telford general election candidates announced
text: nominations closed last night for the general election on 8 june .
names of the parties and candidates to follow .
starting with telford :
author: Tim Page
News Editor, BBC Shropshire

documents.title: large grass fire on railway embankment
text: firefighters had to deal with a `` significant fire '' on a railway embankment next to a heritage line in worcestershire .
the fire , near northwood lane in bewdley , broke out just before 17:00 yesterday on an embankment near the severn valley railway line .
crews were at the scene for two hours - the casue of the fire is not yet known .

documents.title: video : what will the weather be like today ?
text: expect a mixture of light rain and thundery showers with some slightly brighter spells and highs of 18c ( 64f ) .
author: Alex Hamilton
BBC Weather

documents.title: good morning from the bbc shropshire newsroom
text: me and the team will be bringing you the latest news , sport , travel and weather between now and 18.00 .
you can comment on our stories and share your by email , facebook or twitter .
author: Les Walton
Journalist, BBC Shropshire

documents.title: dust devil blows into town
text: dust devil blows into town

documents.title: our live coverage across the day
text: we 'll be back with our usual mix of news , sport , travel and weather from 08:00 tomorrow .
keep an eye out here for more updates this evening and into the morning .

documents.title: telford and wrekin candidates announced
text: the deadline has passed for candidates to register for the general election and there are four people standing in the telford constituency .
they are :
in the wrekin constituency there will be six candidates :

documents.title: tim gill elected ludlow mayor
text: tim gill has been elected the next mayor of ludlow by his fellow town councillors .
he will be assisted by colin sheward , who is serving a second term as deputy mayor .
there will be a mayor-making ceremony to give him the chains of office on 24 may .

documents.title: watch : campaign to buy small village pub
text: villagers in north shropshire are hoping to buy their local pub , after its current owners have decided to sell up .
the railway inn at yorton has been run by the same family for 80 years and simon rowse from the railway inn community venture said he believes there is no reason it should carry on operating .
author: Nick Southall
Journalist, BBC Shropshire

documents.title: weather : a mild night and some rain tomorrow
text: it 's going to be another mild night and the warm weather should continue tomorrow , but there 's a chance of some showers in the morning .
author: Rebecca Wood
BBC Weather

documents.title: your photos : sheep in newport and sunshine in bicton
text: we 've had some great weather this afternoon , and the bbc weather watchers shared these photos from newport ( top ) and bicton ( below ) .
author: BBC Weather Watchers

documents.title: watch : artist using strimmer to create art in carding mill valley
text: a cornish artist is in the carding mill valley this week , creating a giant piece of artwork on the hillside - using a strimmer .
tony plant is just getting started today and says he wants to inspire people visiting the area and he 's calling it the heartlands project .

documents.title: bike4life ride raises nearly £ 74k
text: a charity motorbike ride from shrewsbury to cosford at the end of last month has raised nearly £ 74,000 for the region 's air-ambulance service .
more than 3,500 bikers took part in the bike4life ride out .

documents.title: large amount of gold jewellery stolen from home
text: thieves have broken into a house in wellington and stolen what the police say was a `` large amount of family gold jewellery '' .
the break-in is believed to have happened between 10:30 and 15:00 yesterday at a home on herbert avenue and the items taken included rings , necklaces and bracelets which were 22 carat gold .
the police also said that yesterday they had recovered a large amount of stolen property from a number of unrelated burglaries and charged two people as a result of the find .

documents.title: shropshire health trust needs to make another £ 3.6m in savings
text: a group that pays for shropshire 's health services must still make another £ 3.6m in savings this year , on top of the £ 14.1m saving schemes they have already identified .
author: Shropshire Star

documents.title: football : well-known shrewsbury town fan dies
text: one of shrewsbury town 's best-known fans and fundraisers , chris smith , has died at the age of 64 .
he started running supporters ' coaches to away games in the 1970s , and also set up the superblues , a fans organisation that made regular donations to club projects .
his fascination with the club started when he was two years old and his first voluntary job at the club was as a programme seller when he was 13 .
a few years ago , when the club started up its hall of fame , the first 10 names inducted were nine legendary players and the 10th was chris smith . ''
author: BBC Sport

documents.title: deadline looms for general election candidates
text: would-be mps have until this afternoon to submit application forms to stand in next month 's general election .
many have already announced their candidacies , but we 'll have a full list on the bbc 's constituency pages soon after today 's deadline .
author: BBC Politics

documents.title: your questions : was shropshire once covered by a giant lake ?
text: a reader used the your questions section to ask `` was there once a huge lake that covered most of ancient shropshire ?
and if so , what happened to it ? ''
we went to the prehistory experts at the secret hills discovery centre , for our answer and spoke to stephanie bellows .
she said that after the last ice age , a large meltwater lake developed where shropshire is today and that it eventually drained once the ice dam keeping it in place burst .
the water then rushed through the county , carving out the route of the river severn .
she said if you wanted to go even further back , to the time of the carboniferous period , the whole of shropshire was covered by an ocean , which is why fossilised sea creatures are found here .
at that time , around 350 million years ago , the county sat on the same latitude as the modern-day falkland islands .
author: Andy Giddings
BBC Shropshire

documents.title: firefighters cut horse free from fence
text: firefighters have cut a horse free from a metal fence in telford this morning .
they were called out to weavers rise in ketley bank at 07:40 and found the animal had its feet trapped .
it took them around 20 minutes to release it and the horse was said to be `` fit and well '' afterwards .
and that was n't the only animal rescue this morning - firefighters in bridgnorth had to go to the aid of a cat stuck 40ft ( 12m ) up a tree .

documents.title: your photos : ellesmere and shrewsbury in the sun
text: it 's not quite as sunny as it was yesterday , but we 're still seeing some beautiful photos from the bbc weather watchers .
these ones were taken in ellesmere ( top ) and shrewsbury ( below ) .
author: BBC Weather Watchers

documents.title: football : shrewsbury squad size to remain the same
text: shrewsbury town manager paul hurst says he 'd like to keep his squad size about the same next season .
he says that means a maximum of 22 senior players and another six youth players .
the club has recently released four players , and has offered new deals to the out-of-contract mat sadler , shaun whalley , bryn morris and young goalkeeper shaun rowley .
author: BBC Sport

documents.title: new artificial pitch for telford snowboard and ski centre
text: more than £ 1.7m will be spent to build an artificial pitch in telford .
author: Shropshire Star

documents.title: ice hockey : telford lose young netminder
text: telford 's young netminder sam gospel has decided to go elsewhere next season .
the 23-year-old was in the squad for the tigers ' epl title win this year and in 2015 .
he was used in rotation with jon baston this season and head coach tom watkins described him as `` an excellent netminder '' and a `` very talented player '' .
author: Andy Giddings
BBC Shropshire

documents.title: free rent offered to stall-holders who support scheme
text: oswestry town council is offering free rent to stall-holders willing to support its experiment of an extra day 's trading in the town 's indoor market-hall .
alongside the regular bailey-head outdoor market , the powis hall .
which has previously opened on wednesdays , fridays and saturdays , is now open on thursdays too .

documents.title: museum plans new cafe and gallery
text: the ironbridge gorge museum trust is planning a new cafe restaurant at the museum of iron .
it will occupy the building known as the long warehouse .
it was used by birmingham university , but has been empty for a number of years .
it was hoped that work would start 12 months ago , but the discovery of bats meant it had to be put on hold .
all the surveys have been done and when planning is passed work will begin later this year .
the building will also contain a gallery featuring works from the museum 's extensive collection .
it 's all part of the museum 's £ 15m masterplan which will also see extensive work and improvements to other sites around the gorge .
author: Les Walton
Journalist, BBC Shropshire

documents.title: football : shrewsbury town to enlarge pitch
text: shrewsbury town are planning to have a bigger pitch next season , but the manager says he is n't sure if that 's what he wants .
paul hurst says he would have preferred to wait until he 'd got his squad together , before deciding what size of pitch suits them most .

hurst has made no secret of favouring attacking tactics and using wingers and a bigger pitch could suit that style of play , but he says it might be possible to reduce the size of the pitch if he changes his mind .
in an ideal world that decision would be made once i 'd got my squad together , but i know i 'm being pressed for an answer , certainly from the groundsman .
i do n't know if it 's more about he needs to know if i 'd like it longer and wider for the work to be done initially and then perhaps we could still reduce it . ''
author: BBC Sport

documents.title: your photos : golf balls and sunny green fields
text: we 've had another bright start to the day and here are two of the photos shared by the bbc weather watchers this morning .
they were taken near ludlow ( top ) and wellington ( bottom ) .
author: BBC Weather Watchers

documents.title: residents left distressed by off-road motorcyclists
text: a group of three motorcyclists , described as `` youths '' ' , have been riding off-road on private land in the broseley area .
the safer neighbourhood team has received several reports and is appealing for information .
it says the riders are putting themselves and the public at risk .
the police can issue a warning notice which could lead to bikes being seized and potentially crushed .

documents.title: mini tornado caught on camera
text: staff at an oswestry plant hire firm were blown away when a mini tornado was spotted in their yard on wednesday afternoon .
author: Oswestry & Border Counties Advertizer

documents.title: minor counties call up for all-rounder
text: shropshire have called up the the shifnal all-rounder jack edwards for sunday 's minor counties trophy game against wales at oswestry .
edwards replaces shrewsbury 's dillon pennington , who 's injured .
it 's the only change from the side beaten last time out by cheshire .
both shropshire and wales will be seeking their first win of the season .
author: BBC Sport

documents.title: shropshire 's biggest business event
text: business owners from across the county will be at telford 's international centre this morning for what organisers say is the biggest `` express networking breakfast '' ever held in shropshire .
the business event 2017 has been organised by a consortium of business support groups including shropshire 's chamber of commerce and the marches growth hub .
the event is open to any shropshire-based business and will feature keynote speakers , workshops and advice on finance and funding .

documents.title: new ambulances rolled out for obese patients
text: ambulance services across england have spent hundreds of thousands of pounds to ensure vehicles can cope with a growing number of obese patients .
bariatric ambulances are specially designed and equipped in response to a 10-fold spike in hospital visits linked to obesity in the past decade
the number of admissions has increased from 52,000 in 2006 to 520,000 in 2016 .
at west midlands ambulance service , all of its 420 a & e ambulances are `` bariatric capable '' , but there are eight specialist vehicles and seven on the way , costing £ 114,000 each .

documents.title: shrewsbury stalker impersonated police officer to 'control ' ex 's life
text: a woman impersonated a police officer for more than two years by sending e-mails to an ex-boyfriend in a bid to control and restrict his life .
author: Shropshire Star

documents.title: traffic light 'chaos ' to end soon
text: traffic lights that have caused long delays in shrewsbury are to be removed two days ahead of schedule .

the four-way traffic lights at the reabrook roundabout were put in earlier this week for roadworks as part of the £ 12m shrewsbury integrated transport package , but have attracted anger from some motorists .
the roundabout is on the inner ring road where pritchard way joins bage way and old potts way .
it 's a busy junction in rush hour as people try to get to and from work .
the lights have caused long delays and are being taken down earlier than planned , but still not until next wednesday .

documents.title: watch : your 50-second weather forecast
text: after a cool start to the day , there will be plenty of sunshine around today , but with cloud building later giving the risk of isolated showers .
we can expect top temperatures of 20c ( 68f ) .
author: Charlie Slater
BBC Weather presenter

documents.title: good morning from the bbc shropshire newsroom
text: the team and i will be bringing you the latest news , sport , travel and weather between now and 18.00 .
you can comment on our stories and share your by email , facebook or twitter .
author: Les Walton
Journalist, BBC Shropshire

documents.title: our live coverage across the day
text: we 'll be back with our usual mix of news , sport , travel and weather from 08:00 tomorrow , but keep an eye out here for more updates this evening and into the morning .

documents.title: new pitch to enhance telford ski centre
text: the telford snowboard and ski centre is set to be enhanced with a proposed investment of £ 1.7m .
the money will help to develop a new high quality 3g artificial turf pitch on adjacent playing fields .
in addition there will be dedicated parking and an extension to the ski centre to provide new changing rooms .
the new facilities are expected to significantly increase the year-round use of the playing fields , which are to remain protected under the council 's green guarantee .
telford & wrekin council 's cabinet is being asked to approve the project , subject to planning permission when it meets on 18 may .
if approved , the proposed facility would replace the former madeley court artificial turf pitch .
the target date for completion would be april 2018 , which would coincide with the celebrations of telford 's 50th birthday .

documents.title: ice hockey : telford tigers bid for english national league north
text: the telford tigers have put in an application to play in the english national league north for next season .
the tigers were left in limbo at the end of last season when the english premier league , which they won , folded .
the english national league is now the second tier in ice hockey 's pyramid .
author: Paul Shuttleworth
Reporter, BBC Shropshire

documents.title: father delivers baby at home , because local maternity unit is closed
text: a father from shropshire has spoken of his shock at having to deliver his baby daughter at home , because their local maternity unit in ludlow was closed , due to staff shortages .
amelie made her dramatic arrival at the weekend .
a very fast labour meant there was no time to get to the nearest open midwifery unit , 20 miles ( 32km ) away in bridgnorth .
dad , mark hiles had no choice but to turn midwife himself .
the shrewsbury and telford hospitals nhs trust says there was `` unexpected high levels of staff sickness '' .
which meant the units in ludlow , bridgnorth and oswestry had to be closed to labouring mothers last weekend .

we need services here , we actually live in town , it 's two minutes by car from home to hospital , but the ludlow maternity unit serves clun and the wider community , so we need them here - it 's just too far to travel . ''
author: Satnam Rana
BBC Midlands Today

documents.title: watch : latest weather forecast for the west midlands
text: it 's been a bright and clear afternoon .
we 're expecting lows of 5c ( 41f ) .
find out what else the weather has in store for us overnight and into thursday .
author: Shefali Oza
BBC Midlands Today

documents.title: football : two afc telford utd players accept new deals
text: ben bailey ( left ) and joe fitzpatrick ( right ) have accepted new deals at afc telford united - three other players are considering their offers .
but the club has released dave hibbert and danny reynolds .
author: Tracey Higgins
BBC Local Live

documents.title: your pictures : the sun is shining across shropshire
text: thanks to bbc weather watchers hopton karen and ray for these great taken in the glorious sunshine across shropshire this afternoon .
if you 've got you 'd like to share with the rest of the county visit the bbc weather watchers site and sign up .
or you can email , tweet or get in touch via our facebook page .
author: BBC Weather Watchers

documents.title: telford it firm goes into administration with the loss of 50 jobs
text: telford it company entatech has gone into administration with the loss of 50 jobs .
administrators kpmg say 29 employees are being retained at the stafford park site while efforts are made to sell the business .
entatech 's turnover dropped from £ 117m .
to £ 103m last year .
a spokesman for kpmg said this afternoon that the company has been hit by difficult trading conditions and the loss of key contracts .
author: Tracey Higgins
BBC Local Live

documents.title: smuggled and counterfeit tobacco seized in oswestry worth more than £ 40k
text: about 50,000 cigarettes and more than a 100lbs ( 45kg ) of rolling tobacco has been seized at a shop and associated lock-up in oswestry , trading standards officers say .
they 're thought to be either counterfeit or brought in from abroad .
the stash was found in secret spaces including a remote-controlled compartment hidden by a door frame .
shropshire trading standards officersc believe the haul has a street value of £ 40,000 .
two people have been arrested .
it is disappointing that illicit tobacco continues to be sold in retail premises within the county .
however , despite the extraordinary lengths that these traders go to try and hide their illicit products , we are wise to their methods and will continue to combat this damaging illegal trade . ''
author: Tracey Higgins
BBC Local Live

documents.title: cricket : new blood in bid to help shropshire to win first game of the season
text: promising all-rounder charlie home , the latest member of his family to represent the county , is keen to help shropshire claim their first victory of the season , when they face wales in the unicorns knockout trophy at oswestry on sunday .

home , who is in his final year at wrekin college and has ambitions to become a professional cricketer , knows it 's important that shropshire put some points on the board as they get ready for the third of four group games .
they opened the season with defeats against staffordshire and cheshire .
home comes from a real cricketing family as his dad , ed , played for shropshire , as did jim , his grandfather .
guy , his uncle , is a former county captain , his cousin tom also featured at minor counties level while charlie 's sister , milly , plays for the shropshire women 's team .

i obviously have n't played a lot of minor counties cricket so far and have n't come up against wales before , but from our perspective we have a talented group and if we get things right we will be hard to beat . ''
author: Stuart Dunn
Shrewsbury Town commentator, BBC Shropshire

documents.title: tributes to bishop 's castle man killed in clun crash
text: tributes have been made to man who died when his car overturned on a country road in the south of shropshire .
author: Shropshire Star

documents.title: plans to put doctors of the doors of a & e to cut waiting times
text: health commissioners are planning to put doctors on the doors in a & e at shropshire 's two acute hospitals so that they can assess how serious patients are when they come in .
it 's part of a bid to cut waiting times in a & e by directing patients to the most appropriate service .
shropshire 's two acute hospitals have consistently failed to hit their waiting time targets and in january as many as one in four patients were waiting more than the four hour target for treatment .
by introducing this proposal the hospitals hope that 40 % of the patients who are at the moment going to a & e will be dealt with by a gp .
author: Tracey Higgins
BBC Local Live

documents.title: fourth 'swan room ' to open for end of life care at royal shrewsbury hospital
text: a room specifically designed for patients in their last days will be officially opened at the royal shrewsbury hospital this afternoon .
it 's the fourth so-called `` swan room '' , painted in calm blue and grey , and kitted out with cd player , mood lighting , and reclining chair .
the idea is that families can spend time with their loved one in a peaceful environment .
obviously the ward is really busy and it can be quite chaotic , sometimes , so we want to make sure that the end of life patient , where possible , we move them into a swan room .
it 's a much calmer environment , where relatives can spend a long periods of time with their loved one . ''
author: Kate Tebby
Journalist, BBC Shropshire

documents.title: football : manager plans to make the most of having one of the biggest pitches in the league
text: shrewsbury town could have one of the biggest pitches in the football league next season .
the town manager , paul hurst , has made no secret of favouring attacking tactics and using wingers - he wants a bigger pitch to make the most of that next season .
in an ideal world that decision would be made once i 'd got my squad together , but i know i 'm being pressed for an answer , certainly from the groundsman .
i do n't know if it 's more about him needing to know if i 'd like it longer and wider , for the work to be done initially and then we could perhaps still reduce it .
but the instructions at this moment in time , is to make it as big as possible . ''
author: James Bond
Sports Producer, BBC Shropshire

documents.title: new dementia help sessions in oswestry
text: a new charity in oswestry is trying to make life more cheerful for families dealing with dementia .
the group called connect for life meets once a week and provides brain stimulating activities , respite for carers , and lunch .
alison humphreys from the group says one of the lesser known symptoms of dementia is a loss of interest in , or fear of , socialising .
she worked in the health service for years and always dreamt of running a day-care centre .
connect for life started last october and achieved charity status in january .
the group meets every wednesday at the gatacre pavilion in oswestry .
author: James Bond
Sports Producer, BBC Shropshire

documents.title: two arrested as £ 43,000 of illegal cigarettes and tobacco seized during oswestry shop raid
text: two people have been arrested after over £ 43,000 of illegally smuggled and counterfeit cigarettes and tobacco was been seized from a shop in oswestry .
author: Shropshire Star

documents.title: legal executive says the poor are being denied access to justice
text: a shropshire legal executive says she 's concerned that the poor are being denied access to justice since cuts to legal aid .

emma kenvyn , who 's specialises in family law at a solicitors in shrewsbury , says it used to be the case that you could qualify for free legal advice , known as legal aid , as long as your income was below a certain amount .
now , your children also have to be on the `` at risk '' register , or you have to prove you 've been a victim of domestic violence .
everybody should have the same ability to obtain access to justice .
i do n't think it should be just for the affluent and the rich and i do n't think that people should be struggling to see their children , because of their income . ''
author: Faith Page
Reporter, BBC Shropshire

documents.title: ice hockey : tigers coach to lead summer training camps
text: the telford tigers and great britain coach tom watkins will be leading a series of training camps for youngsters who want to learn to play ice hockey .
there will be a week-long camp starting on 21 august and a number of shorter , weekend camps through june and july .
watkins says he will be joined by a number of experienced players from across the country .
author: BBC Sport

documents.title: national campaign to reduce speed limits backed by town council
text: a national campaign to reduce the speed limit in the town to 20 mph is being backed by shifnal town council .

the town 's mayor , robert harrop , says roads in the town centre are now busier as the population has grown and the hope is , with a reduced speed limit , fewer cars will want to use the roads as a cut through and find alternative routes .
author: Ian Perry
BBC Radio Shropshire

documents.title: whitchurch man , 24 , punched his partner as she gave birth in hospital
text: a new father from whitchurch punched his partner while she was in a hospital delivery room giving birth to their child , a court heard .
author: Shropshire Star

documents.title: trade union appeals for help to find missing banner
text: trade unionists are appealing for help to find their banner , which has gone missing .
it was left outside the castle in shrewsbury at around 11:15 on the 29 april during a march , but when trade unionists returned to collect it at 12:30 it had gone .
if you 've seen it - they 're asking if you can return it to the tuc building at shrewsbury college .
author: Tracey Higgins
BBC Local Live

documents.title: shropshire a & e patients to face 'doormen ' medics
text: doctors will be placed at the front doors '' of shropshire 's two a & e departments to assess patients on their way in .
author: Shropshire Star

documents.title: hurst 'looks to former club ' for players
text: shrewsbury town 's manager , paul hurst , is thought to be looking at full back zak mills and goalkeeper james mckeown - both from his former club , grimsby .
however , the town may have scuppered their chances of signing anyone from grimsby , after taking hurst and his assistant chris doig from the league two side back in october .
hurst is keeping quiet about the player speculation , but insists the relationship between the clubs is a good one .
author: BBC Sport

documents.title: man hands samurai swords in to police
text: four ornamental samurai swords have been handed in to police in newport to be destroyed .
author: Shropshire Star

documents.title: appeal for witnesses after two fatal collisions
text: west mercia police are appealing for witnesses after two fatal collisions in shropshire .
one took place in the early hours of monday morning , between colebatch and bishops castle on the a488 , when a nissan navara aventura travelling from clun towards colebatch left the road .
the driver , a man in his 30s , died at the scene .
the police are also hoping anyone who saw a crash near gobowen on saturday at around 05:00 will get in touch .
a silver audi , travelling southbound , is thought to have left the road and collided with a tree before catching fire - a man in his 20 's died .

documents.title: campaign group calls for lower speed limits on urban roads .
text: a campaign group is calling for speed limits on urban roads to be cut to 20mph .
the group , called `` 20 's plenty for us '' says the move will save lives .
professor john whitelegg , from church stretton , a road safety adviser for the world health organisation , says something similar has worked in sweden but it 's a part of a bigger set of policies .

sean corker , from the alliance of british drivers , who oppose 20mph zones , claims there 's no strong evidence that it makes any difference in urban areas and that it is more about promoting cycling and walking .

documents.title: passengers could share journeys with parcels in the future
text: passengers could be sharing their rail journeys with parcels if a new train carriage being unveiled in the midlands gets the go-ahead .
the concept involves collapsible seats and tables which would make space for small items of freight .
it 's claimed the idea could help relieve congestion on the roads and keep fares rises to a minimum .
the carriage is designed to be used when the rail network is n't busy , such as on late services .
author: BBC Midlands Today

documents.title: watch : your 50-second weather forecast
text: after a very chilly start , wednesday will be dry with light winds and plenty of warm sunshine for all of us .
a few fair weather clouds are likely to bubble up through the afternoon - highs of 19c ( 66f ) .
author: Charlie Slater
BBC Weather presenter

documents.title: good morning from the bbc shropshire newsroom
text: me and the team will be bringing you the latest news , sport , travel and weather between now and 18.00 .
you can comment on our stories and share your by email .
facebook or twitter .
author: Les Walton
Journalist, BBC Shropshire

documents.title: shrewsbury boss waits on contract offers
text: shrewsbury boss waits on contract offers

documents.title: our live coverage across the day
text: we 'll be back with our usual mix of news , sport , travel and weather from tomorrow , but keep an eye out here for more updates this evening and into the morning .

documents.title: watch : baschurch volunteers worry about speeding motorists
text: volunteers with speed cameras in baschurch estimate 250 cars break the speed limit through the village every day .
a lot of motorists use the village as a cut-through between shrewsbury and the a5 , with 5,000 vehicles a day passing through , they said .
they ca n't hand out fines themselves , but pass on details to the police , who then send out warning letters to offenders .
jonathan carr met us by the roadside .
author: James Bond
BBC Shropshire

documents.title: weather : a clear night followed by a sunny wednesday
text: most of us will have a clear night tonight and tomorrow we 're going to see plenty of sunshine , with temperatures reaching 15c ( 59f ) .
author: Charlie Slater
BBC Weather presenter

documents.title: your photos : bees and sun shining on wombridge
text: it 's been a fine end to the day and we are expecting more good weather tomorrow .
these photos were taken this afternoon by bbc weather watchers in norton ( top ) and wombridge ( below ) .
author: BBC Weather Watchers

documents.title: road resurfacing in ironbridge
text: motorists are being warned about road closures and loose chippings in and around ironbridge .
workmen are laying new road surfaces on the wharfage , tontine hill and high street , the lloyds and coalport high street .
there will be no road markings until next week .
after that work is complete , there will be resurfacing work carried out around the dale end roundabout .
author: Andy Giddings
BBC Shropshire

documents.title: football : afc telford united look for new directors
text: afc telford united are looking for new directors to join their board and help `` share the workload '' .

a vote will be held at the club 's egm before the start of the new season and any applicants , plus those current directors who want to seek re-election are being urged to get in touch with the club chairman .
the club is still hoping those directors might include big investors who want to put their money into the club .
author: BBC Sport

documents.title: election sees return of familiar faces for conservatives
text: the conservatives have stuck with the five people who completed a clean sweep for them in shropshire two years ago - owen paterson , lucy allan , mark pritchard , philip dunne and daniel kawczynski .
between them they 've fought in 15 general election campaigns here , with owen paterson ( below ) standing for the sixth time .
lucy allan is defending the smallest majority of the five - 730 in telford .
philip dunne is defending the largest majority - 18,929 in ludlow .

documents.title: fresh traffic safety call after third smash at wem salon
text: fresh calls have been made to introduce traffic calming measures in wem .
author: Shropshire Star

documents.title: your photos : sunshine over pant and oswestry
text: it 's been a bit cooler today , but we 've been seeing some beautiful sunny photos from the bbc weather watchers .
these ones were taken near pant ( top ) and oswestry ( below ) .
author: BBC Weather Watchers

documents.title: no water shortage concerns in shropshire
text: water shortages are n't expected in shropshire at the moment , despite the lack of rain , severn trent say .
last month , the midlands only had about a third of the rainfall usual for april and the environment agency is warning that levels on the upper severn are low .
but stephen jones , a farmer at lower hordley , says it has n't become a problem yet .
author: Ian Perry
BBC Radio Shropshire

documents.title: lambs die after being chased by dog
text: dog-owners are being warned to keep their dogs on a lead when walking across fields with lambs in them after an incident near pentre at the weekend .
a dog off its leash chased livestock , causing two lambs to die from stress .
the police say dog owners face being fined and ordered to pay compensation if they allow their animals to worry livestock .

documents.title: teacher and town councillor to stand for green party
text: the green party has chosen its candidates to stand in the telford and wrekin constituencies at the general election .
it will be represented in telford by 27-year-old history teacher luke shirley ( below , left ) .
the party 's candidate for the wrekin will be wellington town councillor pat mccarthy ( above , right ) .

documents.title: watch : bridgnorth firm has concerns about brexit-delays
text: britain 's departure from the european union wo n't just affect the free movement of people - it could affect the movement of exports too .
that 's causing concern for a bridgnorth car parts maker .
author: BBC Newsnight

documents.title: your photos : cloudy trefonen
text: after the bright start to the week , it 's got become more cloudy today .
this photo was taken by bbc weather watcher kengill in trefonen .
author: BBC Weather Watchers

documents.title: oswestry homes plan continues to go roundabout in circles
text: plans for up to 600 new homes in oswestry look likely to be delayed once again to await official confirmation of proposed roundabout improvements on the a5 .
author: Shropshire Star

documents.title: newcastle man lands 'record ' catfish on first attempt
text: a newcastle-under-lyme man has caught a 61lb 5oz ( 28kg ) catfish in a pool at marchamley in shropshire .
john birkin says it was his first attempt at landing one of the fish and he caught it using luncheon meat as bait .
he decided to name it gypsee because a lady had brought a lucky charm into his bait shop a few days previously .
he believes it may be a record for pools in shropshire .

documents.title: afc telford united admit to 'disappointing ' share re-launch
text: afc telford united have revealed they only sold another 177 shares when they were put up for sale for a second time .
it means the number of shares sold has risen from 32 % to 35 % - a figure the club called `` disappointing '' .
the club has also failed to attract any big investors willing to buy large numbers of shares and it is urging interested backers to get in touch .
despite this , afc telford united says planning for the new season is `` going well '' and that the share offer has led to a clearer management structure .
although the share offer is only 35 % subscribed , it has given us clear ownership , one board , clear accountability , a model that can accommodate new investors going forward . ''

documents.title: early opening date announced for shrewsbury primark store
text: more than 140 jobs will be created when a shrewsbury 's new £ 12m primark store opens in july - months early than planned .
author: Shropshire Star

documents.title: your a dull and overcast day
text: what a difference a day makes - a dull and overcast day across much of the county today , but the sun should be back tomorrow .
author: BBC Weather Watchers

documents.title: free seminar on starting your own business
text: if you have you ever fancied starting your own business , there 's a free seminar taking place in shrewsbury today to give advice and tips how to to it .
the marches growth hub is putting the event on , at their base in battlefield .
it 's on from 10:00 until 13:00 and is aimed at those needing a helping hand taking the first steps towards starting a new business .
author: Tracey Higgins
BBC Local Live

documents.title: ice hockey : uncertainty continues for tigers ' fans
text: telford tigers fans are still waiting to discover what will happen to their team next season , following the collapse of the english premier league .

after two of the teams left to join the elite league and manchester phoenix went out of business , the remaining seven agreed to seek places in the lower divisions , but the tigers still have n't applied for a place in one .
five of the teams have now been accepted in the nihl south and the tigers have until the weekend to seek a place in the nihl north .
to further complicate things , the tigers already have a development team in the nihl north , so the two teams might have to be merged or kept apart .
author: Andy Giddings
BBC Shropshire

documents.title: more people needed to help train guide dogs
text: there 's a waiting list among blind people in shropshire for a dog that could help transform their lives , and an appeal has gone out to find people willing to act as trainers .
denise , a trainer from the oswestry fund raising group for guide dogs uk , says training a dog is a big investment .
each dog is £ 50,000 to train , but that is from the days it 's born , to cover the whole of the puppy , the training , vet bills and food until the day unfortunately it dies .
so we are responsible for the dog for its whole life , even when it 's finished working . ''
author: James Bond
Sports Producer, BBC Shropshire

documents.title: missing teen turns up safe
text: a teenager , reported missing from his home in telford last week , has turned up safe and well .
the police have thanked members of the public and the media for their help in the search for callum smith .
author: Tracey Higgins
BBC Local Live

documents.title: your questions on the general election
text: your questions on the general election

documents.title: witness appeal on mauritius after shropshire couple killed in taxi crash
text: witnesses are being sought on the holiday island of mauritius after a crash which killed a shropshire couple .
author: Shropshire Star

documents.title: new way of re-ordering prescriptions saving the nhs thousands
text: a new way of ordering repeat prescriptions in telford and wrekin has saved over £ 70,000 in just four months , says telford 's clinical commissioning group .
the prescription ordering department , or pod , is a call centre patients ring to order repeat medicines .
it 's used by four doctors practices at the moment after being launched as a pilot last year .
unused prescription medicines cost the nhs over £ 1m every year in telford and wrekin alone and this is designed to keep a closer eye on what people receive and cut down on waste .
author: Tracey Higgins
BBC Local Live

documents.title: watch : your 50-second weather forecast
text: plenty of cloud around throughout the day with a few sunny spells and top temperatures of 13c ( 55f ) .
author: Charlie Slater
BBC Weather presenter

documents.title: good morning from bbc shropshire
text: i 'm here with all your news , sport , travel and weather this morning .
do get in touch if you have a story or that you 'd like to share with the rest of the county .
you can email , tweet or get in touch via our facebook page .
author: Tracey Higgins
BBC Local Live

documents.title: good morning from today 's bbc shropshire live page
text: welcome to the local live service for shropshire on tuesday morning .
we 'll be bringing you all the news , sport , travel and weather as it happens .
if you 'd like to get in touch you can email , tweet us on @ twitterid or message via facebook .

documents.title: our live coverage across the day
text: we 'll be back with our usual mix of news , sport , travel and weather from 08:00 tomorrow , but keep an eye out here for more updates this evening and into the morning .

documents.title: former councillor to be green candidate for north shropshire
text: just days after learning he 'd lost his seat on shropshire council , the green party 's duncan kerr has learned he 's been chosen to challenge for the north shropshire seat in the general election .
he was the party 's first councillor on the local authority after taking the oswestry south ward in a by-election last year .
emma bullard has been chosen to be the party 's candidate in the shrewsbury and atcham constituency for a fourth time .
owen paterson and daniel kawczynski will be contesting the seats in north shropshire and shrewsbury respectively for the conservatives .
earlier today , we heard the lib dems had chosen tom thornhill and hannah fraser as their candidates in the two seats .
other candidates have until 11 may to submit their applications .
after that date we will feature a full list of prospective mps on the north shropshire and shrewsbury & atcham constituency pages .

documents.title: fire service cuts 'savage '
text: the fire brigades union has described plans to cut shropshire 's fire service budget by another £ 2m `` savage '' .
it said over 50 posts had been lost since 2010 and that the remaining workforce was feeling the pressure as a result .
fbu secretary matt lamb said the biggest cut locally has been to the staffing of the rescue tender at wellington fire station , which is used for serious road accidents .

documents.title: horse rider suffers injury after fall at badminton horse trials
text: a rider from south cheshire has suffered what 's been described as a `` traumatic brain injury '' after falling during the badminton horse trials .
emily gilruth , 40 , who lives near malpas is said to have had a stable night but is still under sedation in hospital in bristol after the fall on saturday .
author: Lee Thomas
Newsreader, BBC Radio Stoke

documents.title: your photos : sunshine in horsehay and newport
text: we 've seen some great photos of the sunshine around shropshire today .
these ones were taken by bbc weather watchers in horsehay ( top ) and newport ( below ) .
author: BBC Weather Watchers

documents.title: weather : a cloudier day forecast tomorrow
text: we 've had some blue skies and sunshine around the region today , but we are forecast a cloudier day tomorrow .
author: Charlie Slater
BBC Weather presenter

documents.title: arthur trail launched to coincide with ritchie movie
text: a new guide booklet , which describes shropshire 's links with the arthurian legends , has been produced to coincide with the opening of a new guy ritchie film about king arthur .
the film stars charlie hunnam as the mythical king , but the booklet suggests his real name was owain ddantgwyn and that his camelot was on the site of modern-day wroxeter ,

it draws on research by historians graham phillips and martin keatman and suggests guinevere lived at oswestry 's iron age hill fort and that the holy grail itself may have been found in a north shropshire cave .
a trail of arthurian sites has been created and can be viewed online .

documents.title: muller drops milk prices
text: the dairy company muller , which has its uk base in market drayton , is cutting the price it pays farmers for their milk .
it will be falling by half a pence a litre from 9 june .
since october last year , the company has been steadily increasing the amount it pays , but said increased production was driving down prices .

documents.title: football : hurst says recruitment is the key to improvement
text: the shrewsbury town manager is about to get his first proper run at the transfer market , since joining the club mid-way through last season and he says recruitment is the key to success .
he brought in eight new players in the january transfer window and hopes to add more new faces over the summer .
author: BBC Sport

documents.title: fall in cost of business parking permits
text: the charge for an annual parking permit , for companies in ironbridge , is reverting to its previous level .
the cost was increased from £ 55 to £ 115 last year , but telford and wrekin council has had a rethink , saying it wants to support local business .

documents.title: council reinforces election poster ban
text: candidates standing for election in telford are being reminded they must n't put up posters or election-material on council-owned property .
the authority says the ban applies to all parties and says it will charge parties which break the rule with the cost of removing the posters .
the council says that during the 2014 european elections a number of posters were damaged or defaced with offensive symbols or language .

documents.title: lib dem election candidates confirmed
text: we 're getting closer to knowing who all the candidates will be for the general election in shropshire .
the liberal democrats are fielding candidates in all five seats , with hannah fraser ( below ) standing in the shrewsbury constituency .
tom thornhill will be the party 's candidate for the north shropshire seat and heather kidd will stand for ludlow .
lee dargue will be challenging for the telford constituency and rod keyes will be their candidate for the wrekin .
we 'll feature a full list of candidates soon after the deadline for applications on 11 may .

documents.title: your photos : sunny scenes from around shrewsbury and ludlow
text: it 's been a nice day to be outside and bbc weather watcher shropshire lass seems to have been on a tour of the county today .
these were taken in shrewsbury and near ludlow .
author: BBC Weather Watchers

documents.title: market drayton dairy giant muller to cut milk price
text: dairy giant muller is to cut the price it pays farmers for milk after the long-awaited rebound in the value of dairy produce ground to a halt .
author: Shropshire Star

documents.title: firefighters take ladder up snowdon
text: a team featuring eight firefighters from shrewsbury has reached the top of snowdon , carrying a ladder .
they 've done it to raise money for the firefighters charity and to support an appeal to put defibrillators in shrewsbury schools .
it took them around four hours to reach the summit , carrying the ladder , which they extended to its full 9m ( 30ft ) once they reached the top .

documents.title: man dead after crash near gobowen
text: a man in his 20s has died after his car hit a tree and burst into flames near gobowen .
the police say it happened near the junction of henlle lane and the b5009 at around 05:00 on saturday and no other vehicle was involved .
a teenage boy , who was a passenger in the car , was taken to hospital with minor injuries .

documents.title: council leadership challenge expected from 'super-egos '
text: the man who was leader of shropshire council before the local authority elections , says he expects other councillors will want to challenge him for the job .
and malcolm pate , who saw his conservative group majority increase last week , said there were `` lots of super-egos dashing about the place '' .
mr pate also said he was confident of being re-elected leader when it was put to a vote on 15 may .
i 'm doing this for purely one reason and one reason alone , and that is to get the council out of the mire it was in when i took over . ''

documents.title: football : shrewsbury manager hunting 'high and low ' for new players
text: with their league one status confirmed for another season , the shrewsbury town manager paul hurst says he will be hunting `` high and low '' for new players .
and he says he ca n't afford to be fussy where he looks .
author: James Bond
Sports Producer, BBC Shropshire

documents.title: fresh appeal after teenager sexually assaulted in newport
text: detectives are issuing a fresh appeal for witnesses after a teenager was sexually assaulted in newport .
author: Shropshire Star

documents.title: man dies in crash near clun
text: a man has died after a crash between clun and colebatch this morning .
the car he had been travelling in was found overturned on the a488 at 12:45 and ambulance staff said he was confirmed dead at the scene .
author: Andy Giddings
BBC Shropshire

documents.title: watch : museum trustees setting off on fundraising walk
text: two trustees from the royal air force museum at cosford have set off an a fundraising walk this morning .
the money will go towards improvements to its sister-museum in london .
author: Ian Perry
BBC Radio Shropshire

documents.title: theatre sees increase in attendances
text: attendances at shrewsbury 's theatre severn rose by 9 % in the last financial year .
a total of 185,264 people visited between 1 april 2016 and 31 march 2017 and that follows an increase of 10 % in 2014-15 and 6 % in 2015-16 .
shropshire council , which runs the venue , says 32 % of those people were visiting from outside shropshire .

documents.title: author to open ellesmere 's new library
text: the actress and author virginia mckenna is to open ellesmere 's new library next month .
the star of born free will perform the ceremony at the library at the meres day centre on 27 june , before speaking in an event at the boathouse .
the library 's moving into the centre to be run by a social care charity , after council funding cuts .
author: Tracey Higgins
BBC Local Live

documents.title: your comments : shropshire 's oldest pub debated
text: our item on shropshire 's oldest pub has led to some discussion on the bbc shropshire facebook page , with lots of people putting forward their suggestions .

mel haynes suggested the golden cross in shrewsbury , but norrie porter from camra ruled that one out , saying that whilst the golden cross was built in 1475 it did n't become a pub until 1495 , so the royal oak at cardington narrowly beats it .
margaret sheridan rightly pointed out that the three horseshoes in alveley claims to have opened in 1406 , but as it is closed at the moment , we did n't include it on our list .
the new owners are hoping to reopen it soon though .

and tim maloney put forward a very strong case for the dun cow in shrewsbury , which he says was originally built as a hostel to house the masons who were building the abbey and he believes it has been a pub since 1105 .
but mr porter says that , despite the building 's age and its origins as a hostel , it could only really claim to be a pub from about 1730 .
but again , this is all open to debate and interpretation , so keep the comments coming .
author: Andy Giddings
BBC Shropshire

documents.title: dr julia buckley to contest ludlow seat
text: dr julia buckley will contest the ludlow seat for labour in next month 's general election , the party has confirmed .
she has a phd in research in political institutions and has lectured in politics at nottingham and wolverhampton universities .
the mum-of-two , who lives in shropshire , has been campaigning to keep ludlow 's maternity unit open and opposing the downgrading of telford 's accident and emergency department .
we 're also aware that philip dunne will stand again for the conservatives in the seat .
other candidates have until 11 may to submit their applications and we 'll publish a full list of those standing soon after on the bbc ludlow constituency page .
author: Tracey Higgins
BBC Local Live

documents.title: fire service braced for another £ 2m cuts
text: shropshire fire and rescue service is facing a £ 2m cut to its budget over the next four years .
it follows a reduction in central funding from the government from £ 7.2m to £ 5.2m by 2020 .
the fire service says it anticipated the reductions and it 's put plans in place to ensure it can continue to provide a delivery of service up to 2020 and beyond .
author: Nick Southall
Journalist, BBC Shropshire

documents.title: could shropshire have an airport like liverpool john lennon airport ?
text: an airport should be built to ensure the economic growth of shropshire , a report said today .
author: Shropshire Star

documents.title: another part of former hospital to be turned into flats
text: the go-ahead 's been given to turn another part of an old shropshire hospital into flats .
the refectory at the old shelton mental hospital in shrewsbury will be divided into 12 apartments .
planning officers accepted the developers had been unable to find an alternative use which would keep the hall in use as a single space
author: Tracey Higgins
BBC Local Live

documents.title: two hundred young people checked for dangerous heart conditions
text: more than 200 young people have been checked for dangerous underlying heart conditions in oswestry .
cardiac risk in the young is a charity that raises funds and awareness of heart conditions such as sudden arrhythmic death syndrome , in people between the ages of 14 and 35 .
fundraising group cry for matthew was set up by sue dewhirst after her son , who went to ellesmere college , died suddenly of a heart condition .
it aims to screen a minimum of 400 young hearts every year in shropshire .
it does n't only affect sports people , anybody can be affected by this .
i 've met up with other cry families now , whereby , their sons have died simply by going to bed or sitting watching television .
so it just happened that mine died on the rugby pitch . ''
author: Tracey Higgins
BBC Local Live

documents.title: injured badminton horse trials rider 'responding '
text: a relative of a rider who was seriously injured in a fall at the badminton horse trials says she has started to respond to doctors .
forty-year-old emily gilruth , from malpas in cheshire , fell at the third fence of the cross-country course on saturday .
she 's being treated at southmead hospital in bristol .
a message on social media says the development is `` encouraging '' but there is still a `` long way to go '' .
emily gilruth .
bad fall at badminton yesterday .

documents.title: shropshire fire service to face £ 2m cut to budget
text: firefighters will see £ 2m cut from their budget over the next four years , it has emerged .
author: Shropshire Star

documents.title: county lagging behind with electric charging points for cars
text: there 's been a huge surge in the number of people driving electric cars , but the west midlands is lagging behind when it comes to charging points .
in 2013 , just 3,500 were newly registered in the uk .
in the last 12 months , it 's at almost 95,000 .
we have 23 charging points here in shropshire , compared to 54 in worcestershire .
the west midlands comes out at 8th on a list of 10 regions in england .
author: Tracey Higgins
BBC Local Live

documents.title: weather : another fine and sunny day ahead
text: it will be another fine day with good spells of sunshine for most .
temperatures will be lower compared to yesterday , with a cool northeasterly breeze , although it will still feel pleasantly warm in the sunshine - highs of 16c ( 61f ) .
author: BBC Weather

documents.title: good morning from bbc shropshire
text: i 'm here with all your news , sport , travel and weather this morning .
do get in touch if you have a story or you 'd share with the rest of the county .
you can email , tweet or get in touch via our facebook page .
author: Tracey Higgins
